articles.title: NASA's 'astonishing’ Mars discovery supported ‘thriving life’ on Red Planet surface - Daily Express
articles.description: NASA scientists made an 'astonishing' discovery in photos snapped on the surface of Mars which suggested life once 'thrived' on the Red Planet.

articles.title: Satellite images of craters reveal the power of asteroids and meteorites smashing into Earth - Daily Mail
articles.description: Most craters only last a few thousand years before being filled or eroded, and can then only be identified by unique changes in the ground's minerals from the shock wave created upon impact.
articles.content:
They look like something you would find in a galaxy far far away.

articles.title: Hellish planet has lava oceans, supersonic winds and scorching vaporized rock downpours - RT
articles.description: Imagine a world so hostile to life that it has bubbling lava oceans and it rains vaporized rock. That’s exactly what researchers discovered in a distant galaxy and it could shed light on the formation of our own planet.
